cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, then turn NNW tonight and NNE on Wednesday, tracking toward Florida’s Big Bend and then across the peninsula into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend Gulf Coast, then Florida Atlantic coast north of Cape Canaveral, Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (peak 26% chance) late Thu into Fri with gusts 35–45 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge less than 3 ft possible along the open Atlantic beaches; limited impact inside Port Canaveral
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible across east-central Florida with locally higher amounts causing ponding and minor flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Thu; occasional lightning within outer rainbands
